ratings.comment: Grade consists mainly of writing assignments, quizzes, and a final video.  Stacy is a great, enthusiastic teacher and I usually looked forward to class, even at 8 in the morning.

Super helpful! Nature of this class is difficult; it's really just the grammar rules, special cases of grammar, etc. Study hard, you'll be fine. Originally planned on a double major with Spanish. Taking next semester off, but we'll see where that goes. Stacy is super clear with directions and projects. NO MIDTERMS, NO FINAL EXAM. Attend class!

I wanted to be a Spanish major before this class. Now I don't. This class was not very fun, but it was very easy. I never had to do any of the work, but still managed to easily get an AB. Stacy is a really nice person, the class is just not exciting.

You should definitely take this class with Stacy. She prepares you for tests well and gives good feedback on papers. You can turn in papers a second time for a better grade. Helpful when you make mistakes in class and not mean about it. No final. Video project easier than any I made in HS. Brings in cookies/cupcakes. Class is easier than 204

take classes with this t.a. if you just need to knock out a couple of language reqs., she is perfect, and she'll bring in cookies for everyone at the end. If you're majoring in Spanish I would suggest finding a teacher who's a little more motivated.

I learned more in this semester of spanish than all my high school spanish classes combined. hard grader when it comes to compositions (but they really help you improve). the tests are easy and the final was a breeze. nice lady, and totally approachable. don't be surprised if she brings you candy or bakes you cookies!

I absolutely LOVED her as my TA for spanish.  She was very understanding and fair and seemed to be on the same page as the students.  She made spanish class fun despite all the work, and was willing to give breaks every now and then.  I just found out she is to be my Spanish 204 TA and I could not be more excited.  She is fantastic.

One of the better Spanish TA's I've had. Very willing to repeat things and make concepts clear, but you have to ask her. She is very expectant but fair, although they grade this class mathematically which doesn't help if you're on the border. Thank God for non-foreign TA's.

Stacy is a wonderful T.A. Even at 7:45am, she's excited and ready to teach (I've had other T.A's with bags under their eyes at 10am still.) I had a lot of fun in her class and learned much. Oh, and she brought breakfast to class for us and made us cookies
